Module it.polimi.ingsw
Package it.polimi.ingsw.common.event

Class AbstractEvent

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.common.event.AbstractEvent
Direct Known Subclasses:
AbstractPlayerEvent
public abstract class AbstractEvent
extends java.lang.Object
An event may be generated by the View, the Model or the Controller Events may be sent from the server or from a client Events sent by clients have a sender, the player who sent the message The model may send client-sent events to other clients, in which case the sender is the same as the original sender Events sent by the model may be sent to more than one player by specifying receivers

    • isValid

      public boolean isValid()
      Checks if the parameters of this event are valid related to the sender
      Returns:
      true if valid

    • accept

      public void accept​(ModelEventProvider provider)
      Call the appropriate observer in the ModelEventProvider if present
      Parameters:
      provider - The ModelEventProvider (the visitor)
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the actual event is not a Model -> View event

    • accept

      public void accept​(ResponseEventProvider provider)
      Call the appropriate observer in the ResponseEventProvider if present
      Parameters:
      provider - The ResponseEventProvider (the visitor)
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the actual event is not a Controller -> View event

    • accept

      public void accept​(ViewEventProvider provider)
      Call the appropriate observer in the ViewEventProvider if present
      Parameters:
      provider - The ViewEventProvider (the visitor)
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the actual event is not a View -> Model event

    • getSender

      public java.util.Optional<java.lang.String> getSender()
      Obtains the player that send the event
      Returns:
      The sender, or Optional.empty() if the event was not sent by a player

    • setSender

      public void setSender​(java.lang.String sender)

    • getReceivers

      public java.util.Optional<java.util.List<java.lang.String>> getReceivers()
      Obtains the list of players that will receive the event
      Returns:
      The receivers, or Optional.empty() if the event is destined to a single player or the server

      public void setReceivers​(java.util.List<java.lang.String> receivers)
